meanings.definition: Glamorous: full of glamour; charming and attractive
meanings.sent1: The movie star looked so glam in her sparkly dress.
meanings.sent2: She felt glam and confident in her new outfit.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to look glam by wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night were like a glam blanket over the skyline.
meanings.sent5: The party decorations added a touch of glam to the room.

meanings.definition: Glamorize: to make something or someone seem more glamorous or attractive
meanings.sent1: She used makeup to glam up her look for the party.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover was glamorized with bright colors and bold text.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to glamorize itself by wearing sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: The artist glamorized the landscape with vibrant brush strokes.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement was glamorized with catchy music and flashy visuals.

meanings.definition: Glamour: an attractive or exciting quality that makes someone or something seem special
meanings.sent1: The old castle had a certain glamour that drew visitors in.
meanings.sent2: The glamour of the city nightlife was captivating.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt at glamour involved a bow tie.
meanings.sent4: The glamour of the stage lights made the performance unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The glamour of the diamond necklace caught everyone's eye.
